Pty Ltd (Peter Robinson @drinkcoffee)","details":"When withdrawals are delayed, they are put in the queue defined in this contract.         The \"queue\" is actually a per-user array that gets bigger each time a withdrawal         is added. Users can choose which withdrawals they are interested in and process         just those withdrawals.         Note: This code is part of RootERC20BridgeFlowRate. It has been separated out         to make it easier to understand the functionality. params.maxFind: Maximum number of items to locate.
params.receiver: The account to fetch the queue for.
params.startIndex: Offset into withdrawal array to start search.
params.stopIndex: Offset into withdrawal array to stop search.
params.token: The token to locate withdrawals for.

returns.found: Array of information about pending withdrawals for the token.

params.indices: Offsets into withdrawal queue to fetch information for.
params.receiver: The account to fetch the queue for.

returns.pending: Array of pending withdrawals. Zero fill are returned if the index is beyond the end of the queue.

params.receiver: The account to fetch the queue for.

returns.length: Length of array of pending withdrawals array.

findPendingWithdrawals(address,address,u.notice: Fetch the queue of pending withdrawals for an address for a token type.

getPendingWithdrawals(address,uint256[]).notice: Fetch the queue of pending withdrawals for an address.

getPendingWithdrawalsLength(address).notice: Fetch the length of the pending withdrawals array for an address.
